1â†’# Tasks: Macro System (Lisp-4)
     2â†’
     3â†’**Input**: Design documents from `/specs/016-macro-system/`
     4â†’**Prerequisites**: plan.md, spec.md, research.md, data-model.md, contracts/
     5â†’
     6â†’**Tests**: Required per Constitution VII (TDD Non-negotiable)
     7â†’
     8â†’**Organization**: Tasks are grouped by user story to enable independent implementation and testing of each story.
     9â†’
    10â†’## Format: `[ID] [P?] [Story] Description`
    11â†’
    12â†’- **[P]**: Can run in parallel (different files, no dependencies)
    13â†’- **[Story]**: Which user story this task belongs to (e.g., US1, US2, US3)
    14â†’- Include exact file paths in descriptions
    15â†’
    16â†’## Path Conventions
    17â†’
    18â†’- **Single project**: `src/clysm/`, `tests/` at repository root
    19â†’- Macro system extends existing compiler infrastructure
    20â†’
    21â†’---
    22â†’
    23â†’## Phase 1: Setup (Verification)
    24â†’
    25â†’**Purpose**: Verify existing infrastructure and understand current state
    26â†’
    27â†’- [x] T001 Verify existing macro.lisp structure in src/clysm/compiler/transform/macro.lisp
    28â†’- [x] T002 [P] Verify existing macros.lisp structure in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
    29â†’- [x] T003 [P] Verify backquote token handling in src/clysm/reader/tokenizer.lisp
    30â†’- [x] T004 [P] Verify quasiquote parsing in src/clysm/reader/parser.lisp
    31â†’
    32â†’---
    33â†’
    34â†’## Phase 2: Foundational (Blocking Prerequisites)
    35â†’
    36â†’**Purpose**: Core infrastructure that MUST be complete before ANY user story can be implemented
    37â†’
    38â†’**âš ï¸ CRITICAL**: No user story work can begin until this phase is complete
    39â†’
    40â†’- [ ] T005 Add expansion depth limit (1000) to macroexpand* in src/clysm/compiler/transform/macro.lisp
    41â†’- [ ] T006 [P] Add macro-expansion-depth-exceeded condition in src/clysm/compiler/transform/macro.lisp
    42â†’- [ ] T007 [P] Add unit test for expansion depth limit in tests/unit/macro-test.lisp
    43â†’- [ ] T008 Verify depth limit test fails, then implement in macroexpand* in src/clysm/compiler/transform/macro.lisp
    44â†’
    45â†’**Checkpoint**: Foundation ready - user story implementation can now begin
    46â†’
    47â†’---
    48â†’
    49â†’## Phase 3: User Story 1 - Define and Use Custom Macros (Priority: P1) ğŸ¯ MVP
    50â†’
    51â†’**Goal**: Developers can define macros with defmacro and use them in code
    52â†’
    53â†’**Independent Test**: `(defmacro my-when (test &body body) \`(if ,test (progn ,@body)))` then `(my-when t 1 2 3)` returns 3
    54â†’
    55â†’### Tests for User Story 1 âš ï¸
    56â†’
    57â†’> **NOTE: Write these tests FIRST, ensure they FAIL before implementation**
    58â†’
    59â†’- [ ] T009 [P] [US1] Unit test for &key lambda list parsing in tests/unit/macro-test.lisp
    60â†’- [ ] T010 [P] [US1] Unit test for defmacro with &key in tests/unit/macro-test.lisp
    61â†’- [ ] T011 [P] [US1] Integration test for user-defined macro compilation in tests/integration/macro-test.lisp
    62â†’
    63â†’### Implementation for User Story 1
    64â†’
    65â†’- [ ] T012 [US1] Add &key parsing to parse-lambda-list in src/clysm/compiler/transform/macro.lisp
    66â†’- [ ] T013 [US1] Update compile-defmacro to handle &key bindings in src/clysm/compiler/transform/macro.lisp
    67â†’- [ ] T014 [US1] Add keyword argument validation and error messages in src/clysm/compiler/transform/macro.lisp
    68â†’- [ ] T015 [US1] Verify all US1 tests pass
    69â†’
    70â†’**Checkpoint**: User Story 1 complete - defmacro with full lambda lists works
    71â†’
    72â†’---
    73â†’
    74â†’## Phase 4: User Story 2 - Use Backquote Syntax for Template Code (Priority: P1)
    75â†’
    76â†’**Goal**: Backquote/unquote/unquote-splicing syntax works correctly in all edge cases
    77â†’
    78â†’**Independent Test**: `` `(a ,b ,@c) `` where b=1, c=(2 3) produces `(a 1 2 3)`
    79â†’
    80â†’### Tests for User Story 2 âš ï¸
    81â†’
    82â†’- [ ] T016 [P] [US2] Unit test for nested backquote in tests/unit/backquote-test.lisp
    83â†’- [ ] T017 [P] [US2] Unit test for ,@ inside nested backquote in tests/unit/backquote-test.lisp
    84â†’- [ ] T018 [P] [US2] Unit test for backquote with dotted lists in tests/unit/backquote-test.lisp
    85â†’- [ ] T019 [P] [US2] Integration test for macro using complex backquote in tests/integration/macro-test.lisp
    86â†’
    87â†’### Implementation for User Story 2
    88â†’
    89â†’- [ ] T020 [US2] Review and fix nested backquote handling in expand-bq in src/clysm/compiler/transform/macro.lisp
    90â†’- [ ] T021 [US2] Add dotted list support to backquote expansion in src/clysm/compiler/transform/macro.lisp
    91â†’- [ ] T022 [US2] Verify all US2 tests pass
    92â†’
    93â†’**Checkpoint**: User Story 2 complete - all backquote patterns work correctly
    94â†’
    95â†’---
    96â†’
    97â†’## Phase 5: User Story 3 - Use Standard Control Flow Macros (Priority: P2)
    98â†’
    99â†’**Goal**: Standard control macros (when, unless, cond, case) work correctly
   100â†’
   101â†’**Independent Test**: `(case 'b (a 1) (b 2) (c 3))` returns 2
   102â†’
   103â†’### Tests for User Story 3 âš ï¸
   104â†’
   105â†’- [ ] T023 [P] [US3] Unit test for case macro expansion in tests/unit/macro-test.lisp
   106â†’- [ ] T024 [P] [US3] Integration test for case with multiple keys in tests/integration/macro-test.lisp
   107â†’- [ ] T025 [P] [US3] Integration test for case with otherwise/t clause in tests/integration/macro-test.lisp
   108â†’
   109â†’### Implementation for User Story 3
   110â†’
   111â†’- [ ] T026 [US3] Implement make-case-expander in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   112â†’- [ ] T027 [US3] Register case macro in install-standard-macros in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   113â†’- [ ] T028 [US3] Verify existing when/unless/cond still pass tests
   114â†’- [ ] T029 [US3] Verify all US3 tests pass
   115â†’
   116â†’**Checkpoint**: User Story 3 complete - all control flow macros work
   117â†’
   118â†’---
   119â†’
   120â†’## Phase 6: User Story 4 - Use Iteration Macros (Priority: P2)
   121â†’
   122â†’**Goal**: Iteration macros (dolist, dotimes, do, prog1, prog2) work correctly
   123â†’
   124â†’**Independent Test**: `(do ((i 0 (+ i 1))) ((>= i 5) i))` returns 5
   125â†’
   126â†’### Tests for User Story 4 âš ï¸
   127â†’
   128â†’- [ ] T030 [P] [US4] Unit test for do macro expansion in tests/unit/macro-test.lisp
   129â†’- [ ] T031 [P] [US4] Unit test for prog1 macro expansion in tests/unit/macro-test.lisp
   130â†’- [ ] T032 [P] [US4] Unit test for prog2 macro expansion in tests/unit/macro-test.lisp
   131â†’- [ ] T033 [P] [US4] Integration test for do with parallel bindings in tests/integration/macro-test.lisp
   132â†’- [ ] T034 [P] [US4] Integration test for prog1/prog2 return values in tests/integration/macro-test.lisp
   133â†’
   134â†’### Implementation for User Story 4
   135â†’
   136â†’- [ ] T035 [US4] Implement make-do-expander in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   137â†’- [ ] T036 [US4] Implement make-prog1-expander in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   138â†’- [ ] T037 [US4] Implement make-prog2-expander in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   139â†’- [ ] T038 [US4] Register do, prog1, prog2 in install-standard-macros in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
   140â†’- [ ] T039 [US4] Verify existing dolist/dotimes still pass tests
   141â†’- [ ] T040 [US4] Verify all US4 tests pass
   142â†’
   143â†’**Checkpoint**: User Story 4 complete - all iteration macros work
   144â†’
   145â†’---
   146â†’
   147â†’## Phase 7: User Story 5 - Inspect Macro Expansions (Priority: P3)
   148â†’
   149â†’**Goal**: macroexpand-1 and macroexpand available as compiled functions for debugging
   150â†’
   151â†’**Independent Test**: `(macroexpand-1 '(when t 1))` returns `(if t (progn 1) nil)`
   152â†’
   153â†’### Tests for User Story 5 âš ï¸
   154â†’
   155â†’- [ ] T041 [P] [US5] Unit test for macroexpand-1 as special form in tests/unit/macro-test.lisp
   156â†’- [ ] T042 [P] [US5] Unit test for macroexpand as special form in tests/unit/macro-test.lisp
   157â†’- [ ] T043 [P] [US5] Integration test for macroexpand-1 at runtime in tests/integration/macro-test.lisp
   158â†’
   159â†’### Implementation for User Story 5
   160â†’
   161â†’- [ ] T044 [US5] Add ast-macroexpand-1 node in src/clysm/compiler/ast.lisp
   162â†’- [ ] T045 [US5] Add ast-macroexpand node in src/clysm/compiler/ast.lisp
   163â†’- [ ] T046 [US5] Handle macroexpand-1 in parse-expr in src/clysm/compiler/ast.lisp
   164â†’- [ ] T047 [US5] Handle macroexpand in parse-expr in src/clysm/compiler/ast.lisp
   165â†’- [ ] T048 [US5] Implement codegen for macroexpand-1 (runtime call to expansion) in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/
   166â†’- [ ] T049 [US5] Verify all US5 tests pass
   167â†’
   168â†’**Checkpoint**: User Story 5 complete - macro introspection works
   169â†’
   170â†’---
   171â†’
   172â†’## Phase 8: Polish & Cross-Cutting Concerns
   173â†’
   174â†’**Purpose**: Final validation and cleanup
   175â†’
   176â†’- [ ] T050 [P] Run all unit tests in tests/unit/
   177â†’- [ ] T051 [P] Run all integration tests in tests/integration/
   178â†’- [ ] T052 Verify SC-001: All standard macros compile and execute correctly
   179â†’- [ ] T053 Verify SC-002: (when t 1 2 3) evaluates to 3
   180â†’- [ ] T054 Verify SC-003: Nested backquotes at any depth work
   181â†’- [ ] T055 Verify SC-004: macroexpand-1 shows correct expansions
   182â†’- [ ] T056 Verify SC-005: User-defined macros work like built-ins
   183â†’- [ ] T057 Verify SC-006: Clear error messages for macro errors
   184â†’- [ ] T058 Run quickstart.md validation scenarios
   185â†’
   186â†’---
   187â†’
   188â†’## Dependencies & Execution Order
   189â†’
   190â†’### Phase Dependencies
   191â†’
   192â†’- **Setup (Phase 1)**: No dependencies - can start immediately
   193â†’- **Foundational (Phase 2)**: Depends on Setup completion - BLOCKS all user stories
   194â†’- **User Stories (Phase 3-7)**: All depend on Foundational phase completion
   195â†’  - US1 and US2 are both P1 - can proceed in parallel
   196â†’  - US3 and US4 are both P2 - can proceed in parallel after US1/US2
   197â†’  - US5 is P3 - proceed after US3/US4
   198â†’- **Polish (Phase 8)**: Depends on all user stories being complete
   199â†’
   200â†’### User Story Dependencies
   201â†’
   202â†’- **User Story 1 (P1)**: Can start after Foundational - No dependencies on other stories
   203â†’- **User Story 2 (P1)**: Can start after Foundational - No dependencies on other stories
   204â†’- **User Story 3 (P2)**: Can start after Foundational - Independent but benefits from US1/US2 completion
   205â†’- **User Story 4 (P2)**: Can start after Foundational - Independent but benefits from US1/US2 completion
   206â†’- **User Story 5 (P3)**: Can start after Foundational - Needs macros from US3/US4 for meaningful testing
   207â†’
   208â†’### Within Each User Story
   209â†’
   210â†’- Tests MUST be written and FAIL before implementation (Constitution VII)
   211â†’- Infrastructure code before macro expanders
   212â†’- Unit tests before integration tests
   213â†’- Verify all story tests pass before checkpoint
   214â†’
   215â†’### Parallel Opportunities
   216â†’
   217â†’- T001-T004: All setup tasks can run in parallel
   218â†’- T006-T007: Foundational tasks marked [P]
   219â†’- T009-T011: US1 tests can run in parallel
   220â†’- T016-T019: US2 tests can run in parallel
   221â†’- T023-T025: US3 tests can run in parallel
   222â†’- T030-T034: US4 tests can run in parallel
   223â†’- T041-T043: US5 tests can run in parallel
   224â†’- US1 and US2 can be worked on in parallel (both P1)
   225â†’- US3 and US4 can be worked on in parallel (both P2)
   226â†’
   227â†’---
   228â†’
   229â†’## Parallel Example: User Story 4
   230â†’
   231â†’```bash
   232â†’# Launch all tests for User Story 4 together:
   233â†’Task: "Unit test for do macro expansion in tests/unit/macro-test.lisp"
   234â†’Task: "Unit test for prog1 macro expansion in tests/unit/macro-test.lisp"
   235â†’Task: "Unit test for prog2 macro expansion in tests/unit/macro-test.lisp"
   236â†’Task: "Integration test for do with parallel bindings in tests/integration/macro-test.lisp"
   237â†’Task: "Integration test for prog1/prog2 return values in tests/integration/macro-test.lisp"
   238â†’```
   239â†’
   240â†’---
   241â†’
   242â†’## Implementation Strategy
   243â†’
   244â†’### MVP First (User Story 1 + 2 Only)
   245â†’
   246â†’1. Complete Phase 1: Setup (verification)
   247â†’2. Complete Phase 2: Foundational (expansion depth limit)
   248â†’3. Complete Phase 3: User Story 1 (defmacro with &key)
   249â†’4. Complete Phase 4: User Story 2 (backquote edge cases)
   250â†’5. **STOP and VALIDATE**: Test defmacro and backquote independently
   251â†’6. Deploy/demo if ready - macros are usable!
   252â†’
   253â†’### Incremental Delivery
   254â†’
   255â†’1. Complete Setup + Foundational â†’ Foundation ready
   256â†’2. Add US1 + US2 â†’ Test independently â†’ MVP ready!
   257â†’3. Add US3 â†’ Control flow macros (case) â†’ Demo
   258â†’4. Add US4 â†’ Iteration macros (do, prog1, prog2) â†’ Demo
   259â†’5. Add US5 â†’ Macro introspection â†’ Full feature complete
   260â†’
   261â†’### Parallel Team Strategy
   262â†’
   263â†’With multiple developers:
   264â†’
   265â†’1. Team completes Setup + Foundational together
   266â†’2. Once Foundational is done:
   267â†’   - Developer A: User Story 1 (defmacro &key)
   268â†’   - Developer B: User Story 2 (backquote edge cases)
   269â†’3. After US1/US2 complete:
   270â†’   - Developer A: User Story 3 (case macro)
   271â†’   - Developer B: User Story 4 (do, prog1, prog2)
   272â†’4. Developer A: User Story 5 (macroexpand functions)
   273â†’5. Team: Polish phase together
   274â†’
   275â†’---
   276â†’
   277â†’## Notes
   278â†’
   279â†’- [P] tasks = different files, no dependencies
   280â†’- [Story] label maps task to specific user story for traceability
   281â†’- Each user story should be independently completable and testable
   282â†’- Verify tests fail before implementing (Constitution VII TDD)
   283â†’- Commit after each task or logical group
   284â†’- Stop at any checkpoint to validate story independently
   285â†’- Most work extends existing files rather than creating new ones
   286â†’

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

file.content:
# Tasks: Macro System (Lisp-4)

**Input**: Design documents from `/specs/016-macro-system/`
**Prerequisites**: plan.md, spec.md, research.md, data-model.md, contracts/

**Tests**: Required per Constitution VII (TDD Non-negotiable)

**Organization**: Tasks are grouped by user story to enable independent implementation and testing of each story.

## Format: `[ID] [P?] [Story] Description`

- **[P]**: Can run in parallel (different files, no dependencies)
- **[Story]**: Which user story this task belongs to (e.g., US1, US2, US3)
- Include exact file paths in descriptions

## Path Conventions

- **Single project**: `src/clysm/`, `tests/` at repository root
- Macro system extends existing compiler infrastructure

---

## Phase 1: Setup (Verification)

**Purpose**: Verify existing infrastructure and understand current state

- [x] T001 Verify existing macro.lisp structure in src/clysm/compiler/transform/macro.lisp
- [x] T002 [P] Verify existing macros.lisp structure in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [x] T003 [P] Verify backquote token handling in src/clysm/reader/tokenizer.lisp
- [x] T004 [P] Verify quasiquote parsing in src/clysm/reader/parser.lisp

---

## Phase 2: Foundational (Blocking Prerequisites)

**Purpose**: Core infrastructure that MUST be complete before ANY user story can be implemented

**âš ï¸ CRITICAL**: No user story work can begin until this phase is complete

- [ ] T005 Add expansion depth limit (1000) to macroexpand* in src/clysm/compiler/transform/macro.lisp
- [ ] T006 [P] Add macro-expansion-depth-exceeded condition in src/clysm/compiler/transform/macro.lisp
- [ ] T007 [P] Add unit test for expansion depth limit in tests/unit/macro-test.lisp
- [ ] T008 Verify depth limit test fails, then implement in macroexpand* in src/clysm/compiler/transform/macro.lisp

**Checkpoint**: Foundation ready - user story implementation can now begin

---

## Phase 3: User Story 1 - Define and Use Custom Macros (Priority: P1) ğŸ¯ MVP

**Goal**: Developers can define macros with defmacro and use them in code

**Independent Test**: `(defmacro my-when (test &body body) \`(if ,test (progn ,@body)))` then `(my-when t 1 2 3)` returns 3

### Tests for User Story 1 âš ï¸

> **NOTE: Write these tests FIRST, ensure they FAIL before implementation**

- [ ] T009 [P] [US1] Unit test for &key lambda list parsing in tests/unit/macro-test.lisp
- [ ] T010 [P] [US1] Unit test for defmacro with &key in tests/unit/macro-test.lisp
- [ ] T011 [P] [US1] Integration test for user-defined macro compilation in tests/integration/macro-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 1

- [ ] T012 [US1] Add &key parsing to parse-lambda-list in src/clysm/compiler/transform/macro.lisp
- [ ] T013 [US1] Update compile-defmacro to handle &key bindings in src/clysm/compiler/transform/macro.lisp
- [ ] T014 [US1] Add keyword argument validation and error messages in src/clysm/compiler/transform/macro.lisp
- [ ] T015 [US1] Verify all US1 tests pass

**Checkpoint**: User Story 1 complete - defmacro with full lambda lists works

---

## Phase 4: User Story 2 - Use Backquote Syntax for Template Code (Priority: P1)

**Goal**: Backquote/unquote/unquote-splicing syntax works correctly in all edge cases

**Independent Test**: `` `(a ,b ,@c) `` where b=1, c=(2 3) produces `(a 1 2 3)`

### Tests for User Story 2 âš ï¸

- [ ] T016 [P] [US2] Unit test for nested backquote in tests/unit/backquote-test.lisp
- [ ] T017 [P] [US2] Unit test for ,@ inside nested backquote in tests/unit/backquote-test.lisp
- [ ] T018 [P] [US2] Unit test for backquote with dotted lists in tests/unit/backquote-test.lisp
- [ ] T019 [P] [US2] Integration test for macro using complex backquote in tests/integration/macro-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 2

- [ ] T020 [US2] Review and fix nested backquote handling in expand-bq in src/clysm/compiler/transform/macro.lisp
- [ ] T021 [US2] Add dotted list support to backquote expansion in src/clysm/compiler/transform/macro.lisp
- [ ] T022 [US2] Verify all US2 tests pass

**Checkpoint**: User Story 2 complete - all backquote patterns work correctly

---

## Phase 5: User Story 3 - Use Standard Control Flow Macros (Priority: P2)

**Goal**: Standard control macros (when, unless, cond, case) work correctly

**Independent Test**: `(case 'b (a 1) (b 2) (c 3))` returns 2

### Tests for User Story 3 âš ï¸

- [ ] T023 [P] [US3] Unit test for case macro expansion in tests/unit/macro-test.lisp
- [ ] T024 [P] [US3] Integration test for case with multiple keys in tests/integration/macro-test.lisp
- [ ] T025 [P] [US3] Integration test for case with otherwise/t clause in tests/integration/macro-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 3

- [ ] T026 [US3] Implement make-case-expander in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T027 [US3] Register case macro in install-standard-macros in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T028 [US3] Verify existing when/unless/cond still pass tests
- [ ] T029 [US3] Verify all US3 tests pass

**Checkpoint**: User Story 3 complete - all control flow macros work

---

## Phase 6: User Story 4 - Use Iteration Macros (Priority: P2)

**Goal**: Iteration macros (dolist, dotimes, do, prog1, prog2) work correctly

**Independent Test**: `(do ((i 0 (+ i 1))) ((>= i 5) i))` returns 5

### Tests for User Story 4 âš ï¸

- [ ] T030 [P] [US4] Unit test for do macro expansion in tests/unit/macro-test.lisp
- [ ] T031 [P] [US4] Unit test for prog1 macro expansion in tests/unit/macro-test.lisp
- [ ] T032 [P] [US4] Unit test for prog2 macro expansion in tests/unit/macro-test.lisp
- [ ] T033 [P] [US4] Integration test for do with parallel bindings in tests/integration/macro-test.lisp
- [ ] T034 [P] [US4] Integration test for prog1/prog2 return values in tests/integration/macro-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 4

- [ ] T035 [US4] Implement make-do-expander in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T036 [US4] Implement make-prog1-expander in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T037 [US4] Implement make-prog2-expander in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T038 [US4] Register do, prog1, prog2 in install-standard-macros in src/clysm/lib/macros.lisp
- [ ] T039 [US4] Verify existing dolist/dotimes still pass tests
- [ ] T040 [US4] Verify all US4 tests pass

**Checkpoint**: User Story 4 complete - all iteration macros work

---

## Phase 7: User Story 5 - Inspect Macro Expansions (Priority: P3)

**Goal**: macroexpand-1 and macroexpand available as compiled functions for debugging

**Independent Test**: `(macroexpand-1 '(when t 1))` returns `(if t (progn 1) nil)`

### Tests for User Story 5 âš ï¸

- [ ] T041 [P] [US5] Unit test for macroexpand-1 as special form in tests/unit/macro-test.lisp
- [ ] T042 [P] [US5] Unit test for macroexpand as special form in tests/unit/macro-test.lisp
- [ ] T043 [P] [US5] Integration test for macroexpand-1 at runtime in tests/integration/macro-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 5

- [ ] T044 [US5] Add ast-macroexpand-1 node in src/clysm/compiler/ast.lisp
- [ ] T045 [US5] Add ast-macroexpand node in src/clysm/compiler/ast.lisp
- [ ] T046 [US5] Handle macroexpand-1 in parse-expr in src/clysm/compiler/ast.lisp
- [ ] T047 [US5] Handle macroexpand in parse-expr in src/clysm/compiler/ast.lisp
- [ ] T048 [US5] Implement codegen for macroexpand-1 (runtime call to expansion) in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/
- [ ] T049 [US5] Verify all US5 tests pass

**Checkpoint**: User Story 5 complete - macro introspection works

---

## Phase 8: Polish & Cross-Cutting Concerns

**Purpose**: Final validation and cleanup

- [ ] T050 [P] Run all unit tests in tests/unit/
- [ ] T051 [P] Run all integration tests in tests/integration/
- [ ] T052 Verify SC-001: All standard macros compile and execute correctly
- [ ] T053 Verify SC-002: (when t 1 2 3) evaluates to 3
- [ ] T054 Verify SC-003: Nested backquotes at any depth work
- [ ] T055 Verify SC-004: macroexpand-1 shows correct expansions
- [ ] T056 Verify SC-005: User-defined macros work like built-ins
- [ ] T057 Verify SC-006: Clear error messages for macro errors
- [ ] T058 Run quickstart.md validation scenarios

---

## Dependencies & Execution Order

### Phase Dependencies

- **Setup (Phase 1)**: No dependencies - can start immediately
- **Foundational (Phase 2)**: Depends on Setup completion - BLOCKS all user stories
- **User Stories (Phase 3-7)**: All depend on Foundational phase completion
  - US1 and US2 are both P1 - can proceed in parallel
  - US3 and US4 are both P2 - can proceed in parallel after US1/US2
  - US5 is P3 - proceed after US3/US4
- **Polish (Phase 8)**: Depends on all user stories being complete

### User Story Dependencies

- **User Story 1 (P1)**: Can start after Foundational - No dependencies on other stories
- **User Story 2 (P1)**: Can start after Foundational - No dependencies on other stories
- **User Story 3 (P2)**: Can start after Foundational - Independent but benefits from US1/US2 completion
- **User Story 4 (P2)**: Can start after Foundational - Independent but benefits from US1/US2 completion
- **User Story 5 (P3)**: Can start after Foundational - Needs macros from US3/US4 for meaningful testing

### Within Each User Story

- Tests MUST be written and FAIL before implementation (Constitution VII)
- Infrastructure code before macro expanders
- Unit tests before integration tests
- Verify all story tests pass before checkpoint

### Parallel Opportunities

- T001-T004: All setup tasks can run in parallel
- T006-T007: Foundational tasks marked [P]
- T009-T011: US1 tests can run in parallel
- T016-T019: US2 tests can run in parallel
- T023-T025: US3 tests can run in parallel
- T030-T034: US4 tests can run in parallel
- T041-T043: US5 tests can run in parallel
- US1 and US2 can be worked on in parallel (both P1)
- US3 and US4 can be worked on in parallel (both P2)

---

## Parallel Example: User Story 4

```bash
# Launch all tests for User Story 4 together:
Task: "Unit test for do macro expansion in tests/unit/macro-test.lisp"
Task: "Unit test for prog1 macro expansion in tests/unit/macro-test.lisp"
Task: "Unit test for prog2 macro expansion in tests/unit/macro-test.lisp"
Task: "Integration test for do with parallel bindings in tests/integration/macro-test.lisp"
Task: "Integration test for prog1/prog2 return values in tests/integration/macro-test.lisp"
```

---

## Implementation Strategy

### MVP First (User Story 1 + 2 Only)

1. Complete Phase 1: Setup (verification)
2. Complete Phase 2: Foundational (expansion depth limit)
3. Complete Phase 3: User Story 1 (defmacro with &key)
4. Complete Phase 4: User Story 2 (backquote edge cases)
5. **STOP and VALIDATE**: Test defmacro and backquote independently
6. Deploy/demo if ready - macros are usable!

### Incremental Delivery

1. Complete Setup + Foundational â†’ Foundation ready
2. Add US1 + US2 â†’ Test independently â†’ MVP ready!
3. Add US3 â†’ Control flow macros (case) â†’ Demo
4. Add US4 â†’ Iteration macros (do, prog1, prog2) â†’ Demo
5. Add US5 â†’ Macro introspection â†’ Full feature complete

### Parallel Team Strategy

With multiple developers:

1. Team completes Setup + Foundational together
2. Once Foundational is done:
   - Developer A: User Story 1 (defmacro &key)
   - Developer B: User Story 2 (backquote edge cases)
3. After US1/US2 complete:
   - Developer A: User Story 3 (case macro)
   - Developer B: User Story 4 (do, prog1, prog2)
4. Developer A: User Story 5 (macroexpand functions)
5. Team: Polish phase together

---

## Notes

- [P] tasks = different files, no dependencies
- [Story] label maps task to specific user story for traceability
- Each user story should be independently completable and testable
- Verify tests fail before implementing (Constitution VII TDD)
- Commit after each task or logical group
- Stop at any checkpoint to validate story independently
- Most work extends existing files rather than creating new ones
